description: Construction of 2 x 4-storey blocks of flats comprising 6 x 1-bedroom and 24 x 2-bedroom flats (Including 4 x wheelchair accessible units); 2 terraces of 3 x 3-bedroom houses of 2 and 3-storey height; stopping-up of 2 accesses and provision of 2 new accesses from Eastcote Lane North; provision of 20 parking spaces (inclusive of 4 disabled spaces); landscaping; and relocation of the existing bus stop directly outside the site (100% affordable housing scheme)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment'. | Details indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved. The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) ' Plan for the Environment' | Details of the hard and soft landscaping to be undertaken within the site, including details of green roofs shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved. The details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority. This hard and soft landscaping shall be subject to a landscape management plan, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. This submission shall include details of the management and maintenance of the hedge along the southern boundary of the site. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.8, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | The car parking, disabled car parking and cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved, the parking spaces shall be kept continuously available for car, cycle and disabled car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, disabled car parking and cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | Details of noise mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority Prior to the commencement of the development. The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, and include details of specific glazing, ventilation, building fabric elements with laboratory test certificates and full BS 8233 calculations. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved derails, which shall thereafter be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.'  Reason: In the interests of crime prevention and the safety and security of users of the site, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | A BS: 4142 industrial noise assessment including details protecting the dwellings from external industrial noise sources from the adjacent leisure centre (with the plant and machinery in operation) and nearby railway station including noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | On-site renewable energy production technology, energy efficient design and sustainable construction as described in the submitted Low and Zero Carbon Feasibility Study - AECOM 04/12/2009 which would deliver at least 20% of the predicted baseline energy demand from on site renewable energy generating equipment and meet Code for Sustainable Homes - Level 4, shall be installed at the site prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment), and policy 4A.7 of the London Plan | The layout of the residential accommodation shall provide in accordance with the approved drawings at least 4 of the proposed units to enable occupation by disabled residents and the provision of all of the properties designed to Lifetime Homes Standards as developed by the Joseph Rowntree Foundation.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | Details of a refuse and recycling storage and collection management plan for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved.  Such provision shall be brought into use on the first occupation of the development permitted and shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment', and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4: Refuse Storage. | A revised Green Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of residents and visitors to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport (including baseline data by making comparisons to their site through TRAVL, targets including car ownership for the 30 flats not exceeding 14 vehicles, details of a named travel plan co-ordinator and details of financing for residents annual public transport travel cards for units without an allocated car parking space, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved. The approved Green Travel Plan shall be implemented on first use of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained in operation thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, an annual monitoring report shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise requested.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 21: Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans. | The surface access road and turning area and parking spaces and associated works shall be completed and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter these areas shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site and manoeuvring within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | A contaminated land investigation and risk assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The details shall include the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and all remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, and retained thereafter.  Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | Details of a tree survey method statement setting out the measures to ensure full protection of trees on and adjacent to the site to BS 5837, and means of constructing the buildings and associated overground and underground services, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement. The development shall thereafter be carried out only in accordance with the approved method statement, which shall apply until the end of the construction period.  Reason: To prevent damage to the protected trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1. 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | All of the ecological measures as described in the ecological survey submitted with the application  Ecology Survey - The Ecology Consultancy 06/11/2009 shall be implemented on the site in accordance with a programme of works to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. Once implemented any ecological measures shall be retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interests of nature conservation and habitat protection and enhancement in accordance with policies 3.8 and 3.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'. | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans details of revised plans and elevations to show the removal of the first floor terrace structure connecting blocks A and B shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason:  To provide adequate space on site for service vehicles in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A & B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, or any subsequent Order revoking and re-enacting the Order with or without modification,  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration including roof alteration to the dwellings hereby permitted shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the dwellings hereby approved, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans details of vehicle parking management arrangements to ensure that there are vehicle parking restrictions on the site access roads (other than in the vehicle parking spaces shown on the approved plans) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of future residents and the visual character of the area in accordance policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans details of privacy screening for the roof terrace for the dwelling on plot 6 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason:  To prevent overlooking of the garden area to the west of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans details of 3 additional car parking spaces on the site for the flats in blocks A and B (thereby providing a total of 14 car parking spaces for the flats in blocks A and B) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved. These car parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with the approved detail and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the flats hereby permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking on the site, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans, details of a revised access arrangement for the children's play area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved. The play area shall be formed and laid out as approved and retained thereafter only as a children's play area, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To provide a safe and secure means access for the users of the play space in the interests of crime prevention and to avoid conflict with the vehicles gaining access to the car parking area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing.
